text: SUBJECT:
label: BODY

text: Final Audit Report - The Internal Revenue Service Needs to
label: BODY

text: Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve Customer Service, and
label: BODY

text: Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: BODY

text: This report presents the results of our review of the 1998 TeleFile Program used
label: BODY

text: by small business taxpayers to file an Employer’s Quarterly Federal Tax Return
label: BODY

text: (Form 941).  We evaluated the effectiveness of the Internal Revenue Service’s (IRS)
label: BODY

text: processes for ensuring that the 1998 Form 941 TeleFile Program was successfully
label: BODY

text: implemented.  This was the first year for nationwide TeleFile processing of Forms 941.
label: BODY

text: In summary, we found that the IRS established effective processes for ensuring that the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile Program was successfully implemented.  The vast majority of Form 941
label: BODY

text: TeleFile returns filed in 1998 were accurately processed and posted to the IRS'
label: BODY

text: Business Masterfile.  However, to achieve its long-term goals of increased 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Program participation, the IRS needs to encourage eligible taxpayers to use the system,
label: BODY

text: educate taxpayers on program changes, and provide quality customer service to all
label: BODY

text: TeleFile users.  In addition, improvements to the 941 TeleFile System would prevent the
label: BODY

text: filing of multiple returns by a taxpayer and would allow the system to verify the filing
label: BODY

text: history and electronic signature of TeleFile users.
label: BODY

text: The report recommends that the IRS analyze customer feedback information gathered
label: BODY

text: in 1997 during the 941 TeleFile Program limited expansion to identify ways to increase
label: BODY

text: participation.  It also recommends that the IRS educate taxpayers on the requirements
label: BODY

text: for using the 941 TeleFile System, as well as any program changes, and ensure quality
label: BODY

text: customer service.  In addition, the report recommends enhancements to the system to
label: BODY

text: prevent the processing of duplicate Form 941 TeleFile returns and to verify the filing
label: BODY

text: history and electronic signatures of the taxpayers, or taxpayer representatives, who file
label: BODY

text: Form 941 TeleFile returns.
label: BODY

text: The Chief Operations Officer agreed with the facts cited in the report and is taking
label: BODY

text: appropriate corrective actions.  Management’s comments have been incorporated into
label: BODY

text: the report where appropriate, and the full text of their comments is included as an
label: BODY

text: appendix.
label: BODY

text: Copies of this report are also being sent to the IRS managers who are affected by the
label: BODY

text: report recommendations.  Please contact me at (202) 622-6510 if you have questions,
label: BODY

text: or your staff may call Scott E. Wilson, Associate Inspector General for Audit
label: BODY

text: (Information Systems Programs), at (202) 622-8510.

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH2

text: Page
label: BODY

text: Executive Summary
label: HH1

text: TeleFile is an Internal Revenue Service (IRS) voice response system that allows
label: BODY

text: taxpayers to file tax returns using a touch-tone telephone.  In 1997, the IRS expanded the
label: BODY

text: Telefile System to allow a limited number of small business taxpayers to file the
label: BODY

text: Employer’s Quarterly Federal Tax Return (Form 941) through the 941 TeleFile System.
label: BODY

text: In 1998, TeleFile was further expanded to allow small businesses nationwide to use the
label: BODY

text: system.  For the first six months of 1998, almost 460,000 Form 941 returns were filed
label: BODY

text: using the 941 TeleFile System.  TeleFile is an important initiative in the IRS’ overall
label: BODY

text: plans to increase electronic filing of tax returns.  The IRS has a goal of 16 million
label: BODY

text: employment tax returns being filed electronically by the year 2002.
label: BODY

text: The TeleFile Program is coordinated through the National Office and includes all of the
label: BODY

text: activities that enable taxpayers to file tax returns using the Telefile System.  The
label: BODY

text: objective of this audit was to evaluate the effectiveness of the IRS’ processes for ensuring
label: BODY

text: that the 1998 941 TeleFile Program was successfully implemented.
label: BODY

text: Results
label: HH1

text: The 941 TeleFile Program experienced a successful 1998 filing season, its first year of
label: BODY

text: nationwide use (for the period January 1998 through the end of our fieldwork in
label: BODY

text: November 1998).  The IRS had effectively corrected prior audit findings, and ensured
label: BODY

text: that Form 941 tax returns were accurately processed through the Telefile System and
label: BODY

text: recorded on the taxpayers’ accounts in the IRS’ computer systems.  However, to achieve
label: BODY

text: the long-term goals of the 941 TeleFile Program, the IRS needs to:
label: BODY

text: • Encourage eligible taxpayers to use the 941 TeleFile Program.
label: BODY

text: • Provide quality customer service to TeleFile users.
label: BODY

text: • Improve 941 TeleFile computer controls to prevent taxpayers from filing multiple
label: BODY

text: returns and allow the system to verify a TeleFile user’s filing history and
label: BODY

text: electronic signature.
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Eligible Taxpayers to
label: HH1

text: Use the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH1

text: The customer feedback information gathered during the 1997 limited expansion
label: HH2

text: should be used to increase 941 TeleFile Program participation.  The IRS obtained
label: HH2

text: information from taxpayers who chose not to use the 941 TeleFile System.  This
label: BODY

text: customer feedback showed that many taxpayers had not used the 941 TeleFile System
label: BODY

text: either because they used a paid preparer or because they wanted a paper copy of the
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH2

text: Page ii
label: BODY

text: return.  This information could have been used to focus the IRS’ marketing efforts to
label: BODY

text: address any taxpayer misconceptions about the system.  During 1998, there was no
label: BODY

text: significant increase in the percentage of eligible taxpayers who used the TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Program.  The IRS needs to focus its marketing efforts to encourage more taxpayers to
label: BODY

text: use the 941 TeleFile System.  This will enable the IRS to achieve its goal of 16 million
label: BODY

text: electronically filed employment tax returns by the year 2002.
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Provide Quality Customer
label: HH1

text: Service to TeleFile Users
label: HH1

text: A more effective method for resolving taxpayer problems needs to be established.
label: HH2

text: The IRS has not implemented a process for delivering effective one-stop customer
label: BODY

text: service to taxpayers using the 941 TeleFile Program (correctly handling their questions or
label: BODY

text: concerns during their first contact with the IRS).  Taxpayers with questions regarding
label: BODY

text: Form 941 TeleFile returns are instructed to contact a customer service call site.  The call
label: BODY

text: site representative will then either contact the TeleFile Coordinator to ask the question for
label: BODY

text: the taxpayer or will instruct the taxpayer to contact the Coordinator directly.
label: BODY

text: Taxpayers should be informed when they are no longer eligible to participate in the
label: HH2

text: 941 TeleFile Program.  If a taxpayer’s annual Form 941 liability exceeds a certain dollar
label: HH2

text: criteria, then the taxpayer is no longer eligible to use the 941 TeleFile System.  The IRS
label: BODY

text: has no procedures to notify taxpayers of this and to suggest other electronic methods for
label: BODY

text: filing the Form 941 returns.
label: BODY

text: The 941 TeleFile forms and instructions should be timely updated to reflect
label: HH2

text: program changes.  The 941 TeleFile tax package (which includes the forms and
label: HH2

text: instructions mailed to taxpayers) was not timely updated to indicate that the IRS would
label: BODY

text: accept returns with a higher balance due amount than had been accepted previously.
label: BODY

text: Some taxpayers may not have used the 941 TeleFile System because of the incorrect
label: BODY

text: instructions.
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Improve 941 TeleFile Computer
label: HH1

text: Controls to Prevent Taxpayers From Filing Multiple Returns and Allow
label: HH1

text: the System to Verify a TeleFile User’s Filing History and Electronic
label: HH1

text: Signature
label: HH1

text: The 941 TeleFile System should prevent multiple returns from being filed by a
label: HH2

text: taxpayer.  Normally, TeleFile returns are received at one processing site, with a backup
label: HH2

text: site available to handle the excess volume.  If both sites are receiving returns, and a
label: BODY

text: taxpayer files a second (amended) return on the same day the first (original) return was
label: BODY

text: filed, both returns could be accepted by TeleFile if the returns were processed at separate
label: BODY

text: sites.  The IRS would not be aware of the potential duplicate or amended return because
label: BODY

text: data from the two sites are only merged and updated at the end of the day.  When this
label: BODY

text: occurs, TeleFile always processes the return received at the main processing site, and not
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH2

text: Page iii
label: BODY

text: the return from the backup site, even though the taxpayer may have intended otherwise.
label: BODY

text: While this should not be a common occurrence, we performed some limited testing and
label: BODY

text: identified several instances where a taxpayer filed more than one return on the same day.
label: BODY

text: This is a systemic problem that will be compounded as the population of TeleFile users
label: BODY

text: increases.
label: BODY

text: The look-back period could be used to ensure businesses are authenticated
label: HH2

text: (i.e., verified) to use the 941 TeleFile System.  The IRS requires taxpayers to be in
label: HH2

text: business for at least 12 months before using the 941 TeleFile System.  However, the
label: BODY

text: existing 941 TeleFile System will accept and process returns from taxpayers, even though
label: BODY

text: they are not authenticated to use the 941 TeleFile System.  The IRS has a current process
label: BODY

text: in place (the look-back period) that could be used to provide the IRS with more assurance
label: BODY

text: that taxpayers have an established filing history when using the 941 TeleFile System.
label: BODY

text: The process for verifying the electronic signature of 941 TeleFile System users needs
label: HH2

text: to be improved.  There is not an effective process to ensure that returns filed using the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile System were actually filed by the taxpayers or their representatives.  The
label: BODY

text: process for verifying the electronic signatures of the taxpayers is incomplete because
label: BODY

text: (1) only a sample of the electronic signatures are verified as correct, and (2) there are no
label: BODY

text: procedures for following up on invalid signatures.
label: BODY

text: Summary of Recommendations
label: HH1

text: The IRS should analyze the customer feedback information gathered during the
label: BODY

text: 1997 limited expansion to determine how 941 TeleFile Program participation can be
label: BODY

text: increased.  In addition, the IRS needs to ensure 941 TeleFile Program taxpayers are given
label: BODY

text: quality customer service when resolving taxpayer problems with the 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Program.  Also, the 941 TeleFile computer controls need to be enhanced to prevent
label: BODY

text: duplicate Form 941 returns from being filed and to improve the process for verifying the
label: BODY

text: filing history and electronic signature of taxpayers using the 941 TeleFile System.
label: BODY

text: Management’s Response:  IRS management agreed with the conditions cited in the report
label: BODY

text: and has designed and, in some instances, implemented actions to correct the problems.
label: BODY

text: To improve its marketing effort to increase participation in the 941 TeleFile Program, the
label: BODY

text: IRS has contracted with a vendor to develop a comprehensive marketing and
label: BODY

text: communication strategy that will focus on the Form 941 products.  In addition, the IRS
label: BODY

text: has made several enhancements and clarifications to the 1998 TeleFile tax package to
label: BODY

text: address customer feedback received in 1997 and 1998.
label: BODY

text: To ensure 941 TeleFile Program taxpayers are given quality customer service, the IRS
label: BODY

text: will update the instructions for its telephone representatives to include additional program
label: BODY

text: detail, processing guidelines, and questions and answers.  In addition, the IRS tested an
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve

label: HH2

text: Page iv
label: BODY

text: Employment Tax call site for small businesses this past filing season and, based on the
label: BODY

text: favorable results, plans to request the establishment of the call site.
label: BODY

text: To prevent duplicate returns from being filed, the IRS has implemented a process to
label: BODY

text: eliminate duplicate returns when multiple sites are used to process returns.  To improve
label: BODY

text: the process for verifying the identity of taxpayers using TeleFile, the IRS will redesign
label: BODY

text: the return filing confirmation number to make it unique for each taxpayer.

text: Objective and Scope
label: BODY

text: The TeleFile Program for the Employer’s Quarterly
label: BODY

text: Federal Tax Return (Form 941) was designed to provide
label: BODY

text: businesses with flexible and convenient ways to file
label: BODY

text: returns.  The overall objective of the audit was to evaluate
label: BODY

text: the effectiveness of the Internal Revenue Service’s (IRS)
label: BODY

text: processes for ensuring that the 1998 941 TeleFile Program
label: BODY

text: was successfully implemented.
label: BODY

text: Specifically, we:
label: BODY

text: • Evaluated actions taken in response to a prior audit
label: BODY

text: report titled, “Evaluation of the 1997 TeleFile Pilot -
label: BODY

text: Business Masterfile” (Reference Number 080704,
label: BODY

text: Dated December 2, 1997) on the 1997 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: limited expansion for Form 941 tax returns.
label: BODY

text: • Evaluated the effectiveness of the IRS’ processes for
label: BODY

text: ensuring Form 941 TeleFile returns were accurately
label: BODY

text: processed nationwide.
label: BODY

text: • Evaluated the effectiveness of the IRS’ publicity
label: BODY

text: efforts to increase the number of businesses that file
label: BODY

text: returns using the 941 TeleFile System.
label: BODY

text: The review was conducted between July 1998 and
label: BODY

text: November 1998 at the National Office and the
label: BODY

text: Cincinnati Service Center (CSC), with limited testing at
label: BODY

text: the Tennessee (TCC) and Martinsburg Computing
label: BODY

text: Centers (MCC).  These centers are the IRS offices
label: BODY

text: where TeleFile returns are filed and processed.  We
label: BODY

text: performed this review in accordance with Government
label: BODY

text: Auditing Standards.
label: BODY

text: Appendix I provides the detailed objective, scope, and
label: BODY

text: methodology used to conduct the audit; Appendix II lists
label: BODY

text: the major contributors to this report; and Appendix III
label: BODY

text: reflects the Report Distribution List.
label: BODY

text: During the review, we issued two audit memoranda
label: BODY

text: communicating several issues requiring immediate
label: BODY

text: attention.  This report presents a summary of the
label: BODY

text: two memoranda and additional audit results completed
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: evaluate the effectiveness of
label: BODY

text: the IRS’ processes for
label: BODY

text: ensuring that the 1998 941
label: BODY

text: TeleFile Program was
label: BODY

text: successfully implemented.

text: Background
label: HH1

text: TeleFile is a voice response system that allows
label: BODY

text: taxpayers to file tax returns using a touch-tone
label: BODY

text: telephone.  The Telefile System uses Electronic Filing
label: BODY

text: (ELF) to process returns.  The Program is coordinated
label: BODY

text: through the Electronic Tax Administration (ETA) Office
label: BODY

text: at the National Office and includes all of the activities
label: BODY

text: that enable taxpayers to file tax returns using the Telefile
label: BODY

text: System.  Beginning in 1996, the TeleFile Program
label: BODY

text: enabled individual taxpayers across the nation to file
label: BODY

text: returns over the telephone.  The IRS expanded the
label: BODY

text: Program in 1997 by allowing a limited number of small
label: BODY

text: business taxpayers to file Form 941 returns through the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile System.
label: BODY

text: On December 2, 1997, the IRS Inspection Service (now
label: BODY

text: Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration)
label: BODY

text: issued a report titled, “Evaluation of the 1997 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Pilot - Business Masterfile.”  The purpose of that audit
label: BODY

text: was to evaluate controls over the 941 TeleFile Program
label: BODY

text: and determine whether it was properly implemented.
label: BODY

text: We concluded that the IRS experienced a successful
label: BODY

text: limited expansion with 48,834 Form 941 returns filed
label: BODY

text: and 99 percent of the businesses able to access the
label: BODY

text: system on their first attempt.  However, the following
label: BODY

text: issues were also identified:
label: BODY

text: • The 941 TeleFile Program allowed new
label: BODY

text: businesses and businesses that were not current
label: BODY

text: with their filing requirements to participate in the
label: BODY

text: Program.
label: BODY

text: • Taxpayers in the 941 TeleFile Program were not
label: BODY

text: always properly verified.
label: BODY

text: • Instructions in the Form 941 TeleFile package
label: BODY

text: contained an error that could be confusing to
label: BODY

text: taxpayers.
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program

label: BODY

text: ETA management generally agreed with our
label: BODY

text: recommendations and established plans for corrective
label: BODY

text: action.  In 1998, TeleFile was further expanded to allow
label: BODY

text: small business taxpayers nationwide to file Form 941
label: BODY

text: returns electronically.
label: BODY

text: Results
label: HH1

text: Overall, the IRS has established effective processes for
label: BODY

text: ensuring that the 941 TeleFile Program was successfully
label: BODY

text: implemented.  For example, Form 941 TeleFile returns
label: BODY

text: filed in 1998 were accurately processed and posted to
label: BODY

text: the taxpayers’ accounts.  In addition, the IRS
label: BODY

text: implemented corrective actions from the 1997 audit,
label: BODY

text: which increased assurances that only authorized
label: BODY

text: taxpayers participated in the Program.
label: BODY

text: Nearly 460,000 employment tax returns were filed for
label: BODY

text: the first six months of calendar year 1998 using the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile System.  In addition, approximately
label: BODY

text: 94 percent of the business taxpayers that attempted to
label: BODY

text: file over the telephone in the second quarter of calendar
label: BODY

text: year 1998 were successful.  The remaining six percent
label: BODY

text: of the taxpayers were either not allowed by the IRS to
label: BODY

text: complete their TeleFile return because they did not meet
label: BODY

text: the eligibility requirements or they hung-up before
label: BODY

text: completing their return.
label: BODY

text: Although the IRS had a successful 1998 filing season
label: BODY

text: (January 1998 through December 1998) for the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile Program, additional actions are needed to
label: BODY

text: market the 941 TeleFile Program to eligible users and to
label: BODY

text: improve customer service for TeleFile users.
label: BODY

text: Improvements in these two areas should enhance the
label: BODY

text: IRS’ ability to achieve its goal of 16 million
label: BODY

text: employment tax returns being filed electronically by the
label: BODY

text: year 2002.  The IRS needs to improve its marketing and
label: BODY

text: customer service by:
label: BODY

text: • Using the customer feedback information gathered
label: BODY

text: during the 1997 limited expansion to increase
label: BODY

text: TeleFile Program participation.
label: BODY

text: ETA management agreed with
label: BODY

text: the results from the prior
label: BODY

text: report and established plans
label: BODY

text: for corrective action.
label: BODY

text: Nationwide implementation of
label: BODY

text: the 941 TeleFile Program was
label: BODY

text: successful.
label: BODY

text: Additional actions are needed
label: BODY

text: to ensure the IRS achieves its
label: BODY

text: goal of 16 million employment
label: BODY

text: tax returns being filed
label: BODY

text: electronically by the
label: BODY

text: year 2002.
label: BODY

text: 95 percent of the electronic signatures were valid.  Five

text: percent of the signatures were not valid because the SSN
label: BODY

text: did not match the name control.  However, the IRS does
label: BODY

text: not have procedures to follow up on the invalid
label: BODY

text: signatures, allowing potential invalid returns to be filed.
label: BODY

text: This raises the question about the purpose of this quality
label: BODY

text: review.  If it is important to verify the signature by
label: BODY

text: manually reviewing a sample of returns, then the IRS
label: BODY

text: should follow up on the invalid signatures.
label: BODY

text: Recommendations
label: BODY

text: 5. The IRS should update the 941 TeleFile System
label: BODY

text: using the same update process used by the IMF
label: BODY

text: Telefile System.  This process would result in
label: BODY

text: updates every 15 minutes, which reduces the risk of
label: BODY

text: multiple returns being filed.
label: BODY

text: 6. The IRS should require taxpayers to be in business
label: BODY

text: for the entire look-back period to be eligible to
label: BODY

text: participate in the 941 TeleFile Program.
label: BODY

text: 7. The IRS should assess the risks associated with the
label: BODY

text: electronic signature process and develop appropriate
label: BODY

text: actions based on this assessment.  If the IRS elects to
label: BODY

text: continue the existing process, we recommend that
label: BODY

text: the IRS determine an acceptable error rate for
label: BODY

text: invalid signatures and take appropriate action when
label: BODY

text: the error rate is exceeded.
label: BODY

text: Management’s Response:  To prevent duplicate returns
label: BODY

text: from being filed, the IRS has implemented a Data
label: BODY

text: Replication process to eliminate duplicate returns when
label: BODY

text: multiple sites are used to process returns .  This process
label: BODY

text: will be tracked to ensure it is successful.
label: BODY

text: ETA management will analyze the computer program
label: BODY

text: criteria for determining if a taxpayer is eligible to use
label: BODY

text: the 941 TeleFile System to ensure it is capturing eligible
label: BODY

text: filers for the full look-back period.  ETA management is
label: BODY

text: also researching the possibility of allowing all new
label: BODY

text: businesses that otherwise meet the 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Program requirements to use the System.
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH2

text: Page 15
label: BODY

text: The IRS is researching a random sample of SSNs for
label: BODY

text: invalid electronic signatures.  The IRS is sending letters
label: BODY

text: to the taxpayers who provided the invalid signatures,
label: BODY

text: and informing them their tax return may be delayed until
label: BODY

text: the letter is returned with a valid signature.  The IRS is
label: BODY

text: also working on redesigning the return filing
label: BODY

text: confirmation number so that it will be unique to each
label: BODY

text: taxpayer, which will allow the IRS to continue to track
label: BODY

text: the electronic signature information on a quarterly basis.
label: BODY

text: The results of the electronic signature information and
label: BODY

text: an assessment of the error rate will continue to be
label: BODY

text: reported.
label: BODY

text: Conclusion
label: HH1

text: Overall, the IRS experienced a successful 1998 filing
label: BODY

text: season for the 941 TeleFile Program.  Returns were
label: BODY

text: accurately processed and approximately 94 percent of
label: BODY

text: the business taxpayers attempting to file electronically
label: BODY

text: through the 941 TeleFile System were successful.
label: BODY

text: Improving the marketing and customer service processes
label: BODY

text: will increase assurances that more of the eligible filers
label: BODY

text: will use the 941 TeleFile Program in the future.  In
label: BODY

text: addition, improvements to the 941 TeleFile System will
label: BODY

text: prevent taxpayers from filing multiple returns and will
label: BODY

text: improve the process for verifying the filing history and
label: BODY

text: electronic signatures of taxpayers using the 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: System.
label: BODY

text: The IRS is redesigning the
label: BODY

text: return filing confirmation
label: BODY

text: number to make it unique for
label: BODY

text: each taxpayer.
label: BODY

text: Ninety-four percent of the
label: BODY

text: businesses that attempted to
label: BODY

text: use the 941 TeleFile System in
label: BODY

text: the second quarter of calendar
label: BODY

text: year 1998 were successful.
label: BODY

text: Detailed Objective, Scope, and Methodology
label: HH2

text: The overall objective of this audit was to evaluate the effectiveness of the Internal Revenue
label: BODY

text: Service’s (IRS) processes for ensuring that the 1998 941 TeleFile Program was successfully
label: BODY

text: implemented.   To accomplish the overall objective, we conducted the following tests:
label: BODY

text: Evaluated whether the IRS took appropriate actions to address the following
label: BODY

text: issues identified in the prior review.
label: BODY

text: Determined whether taxpayers were adequately identified by selecting a
label: BODY

text: sample of 50 Employer’s Quarterly Federal Tax Return (Form 941)
label: BODY

text: TeleFile returns to determine whether the taxpayer had to enter the correct
label: BODY

text: amount in the security field (total third quarter Federal Tax Deposit
label: BODY

text: amount from the prior year) before being allowed to file.
label: BODY

text: Determined whether only eligible taxpayers filed 941 TeleFile returns.
label: BODY

text: II.
label: BODY

text: Matched the Martinsburg Computing Center requirements for extracting
label: BODY

text: 1998 eligible 941 TeleFile businesses to the 1998 TeleFile package.
label: BODY

text: III.
label: BODY

text: Reviewed 941 TeleFile returns filed for the second quarter of calendar year 1998
label: BODY

text: to determine whether only eligible businesses filed.
label: BODY

text: IV.
label: BODY

text: Determined the effectiveness of the IRS’ processes for ensuring 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: returns were accurately processed and accounted for during the nationwide
label: BODY

text: implementation.
label: BODY

text: Reviewed a sample of 114 Form 941 TeleFile returns filed for the second
label: BODY

text: quarter of calendar year 1998 and determined whether taxpayer return
label: BODY

text: information posted correctly to the Masterfile.
label: BODY

text: Tracked the second quarter 941 TeleFile returns from the Tennessee
label: BODY

text: Computing Center and Cincinnati Service Center Telefile Systems to the
label: BODY

text: Masterfile.
label: BODY

text: Evaluated the IRS’ efforts to verify the electronic signatures (Social
label: BODY

text: Security Numbers and last name) used to sign the 941 TeleFile returns.
label: BODY

text: Assessed publicity efforts for increasing the number of businesses who filed
label: BODY

text: 1998 returns using the 941 TeleFile Program.
label: BODY

text: Evaluated the IRS’ efforts to market the 1998 941 TeleFile Program by
label: BODY

text: reviewing marketing materials and interviewing project office employees.
label: BODY

text: BMF TeleFile 1998 Expansion – Internal Audit Memorandum #1
label: BODY

text: This memorandum is to advise you of an error in the fourth quarter 941 TeleFile
label: BODY

text: Instructions that may adversely effect the number of taxpayers participating in the BMF
label: BODY

text: TeleFile program. Although Internal Revenue Manual 1289 provides 30 workdays for
label: BODY

text: responding to an Internal Audit memorandum, we are requesting that you advise us of the
label: BODY

text: action you plan take in a written response within 10 workdays.  This request is being
label: BODY

text: made as a result of the time sensitivity of the issue.  If you have any suggestions for
label: BODY

text: improving or clarifying this memorandum, please contact me or Audit Manager Jim
label: BODY

text: Westcott at (606) 292-5162.
label: BODY

text: Instructions to the BMF TeleFile package have not been updated to reflect program
label: HH2

text: enhancements scheduled for the Telefile System in the fourth quarter.
label: HH2

text: We determined that the 941 TeleFile Tax packages have not been revised to show that the
label: BODY

text: $500 balance due limit is no longer in effect. The Service is in the process of enhancing
label: BODY

text: the BMF TeleFile program to accept all balance due returns effective January 4, 1999.
label: BODY

text: This change will eliminate the restriction for taxpayers who owe a balance due of $500 or
label: BODY

text: more. Previously, if a taxpayer attempted to file and had a balance due of $500 or more
label: BODY

text: they would receive a message indicating that their balance due exceeded the balance due
label: BODY

text: amount that TeleFile can accept and that the Service cannot continue with the processing
label: BODY

text: of their return.  Furthermore, taxpayers would be advised to file a paper return for the
label: BODY

text: quarter.
label: BODY

text: Our review showed that the TeleFile package instructions and the 941 TeleFile Tax
label: BODY

text: Record have not been revised to eliminate the balance due criteria of $500 or more.  Line
label: BODY

text: 15 of the 941 TeleFile Tax Record incorrectly tells the taxpayer that if they owe a balance
label: BODY

text: due of $500 or more, they cannot use 941 TeleFile.  This information is also included on
label: BODY

text: Page TEL-1 of the tax package instructions.  Modifications to the 941 TeleFile Program
label: BODY

text: for the fourth quarter eliminated the restriction of taxpayers who owe a balance due of
label: BODY

text: The Internal Revenue Service Needs to Encourage Taxpayer Use, Improve
label: HH3

text: Customer Service, and Enhance Computer Controls of the 941 TeleFile Program
label: HH2

text: Page  21
label: HH3

text: $500 or more.  The BMF TeleFile packages are scheduled to be mailed in December
label: BODY

text: 1998, for the fourth quarter.
label: BODY

text: This oversight to the instructions will cause taxpayers not to use the BMF TeleFile
label: BODY

text: program. We estimate the Service plans to mail approximately 3.4 million 941TeleFile
label: BODY

text: packages for the fourth quarter. With the emphasis on customer service and on increasing
label: BODY

text: the number of taxpayers filing returns electronically, the Service cannot afford to
label: BODY

text: overlook issues that may impact these goals.
label: BODY

text: Recommendation
label: HH2

text: To minimize losing potential taxpayers that are eligible to file 941 TeleFile, we
label: BODY

text: recommend that the fourth and subsequent quarter TeleFile tax packages, including the
label: BODY

text: 941 TeleFile Tax Record line 15, be revised by removing the reference to the $500
label: BODY

text: balance due.
